Larry Daley.Action: Works as a Night Guard at the Museum of Natural History, entrusted with overnight security duties.
Addresses worker Carlos politely and gives a clear instruction to improve packaging quality.
Walks confidently through his busy warehouse in a nice suit, showing ownership and leadership.
Acknowledges Rose's reading and accepts compliment sincerely.
Ponders his magazine cover image with slight discomfort but shows gratitude to Rose.
Interacts politely and familiarly with his driver, shows trust.
Carefully considers and acknowledges criticism about failing to launch a new product in 22 months, showing awareness of his business challenges.
Looks a little uncomfortable reflecting on magazine cover praise, indicating some self-doubt or modesty.
Engages in detailed communication with staff about shipping logistics, demonstrating involvement and attention to operational details.
Politely declines the driver's offer to wait and proceeds to the museum despite it being closed for renovations.
Knocks and interacts calmly with the Museum Director who initially reprimands him but then lets him in.
Shows curiosity and openness by asking what is going on with the new exhibits and listening to McPhee's explanation.
Responds politely and honestly when addressed unexpectedly by hologram Teddy Roosevelt.
Asks what the hologram displays are, showing curiosity but also unfamiliarity with new technology.
Carefully catches Dexter the monkey when McPhee tosses him back into the crate, showing care for the animal.
Questions McPhee about the removal and storage of museum animals and artifacts, expressing concern for them.
Engages politely and attentively during the interaction with the hologram Teddy Roosevelt and McPhee.
Does not challenge McPhee's dismissive and rude attitude towards the animals and artifacts, remaining passive.
Catches Dexter the monkey carefully when McPhee tosses the crate.
Correctly identifies Dexter as a Capuchin monkey.
Asks questions about the fate of the museum exhibits showing concern.
Fumbles with questions to Hologram Teddy Roosevelt (e.g., mispronounces some words and hesitates).
Responds confidently to McPhee that he remembers how to lock up after McPhee sarcastically questions him.
Handing out gifts to all the Museum residents like a dad returning from a business trip, telling them to take turns patiently.
Responds to the Easter Island Head’s teasing with a mild insult 'fat-head' but immediately follows with a friendly gesture of giving gum.
Notices Jedediah trapped in a crate and quickly acts to free him and Octavius.
Checks in with the characters' feelings about the move, showing concern and attentiveness.
Watches the group cheer enthusiastically, joins in the shared excitement silently.
Says farewell warmly and promises to visit after they settle in.

Pauses thoughtfully when Jedediah quietly expresses concern, showing consideration.
Shows concern for the well-being of the exhibits and confirms key items like the tablet before shipment.
Reluctantly closes the crate tops, indicating a sense of responsibility and carefulness.
Pauses to consider Jedediah's quiet question about the Archives, showing thoughtfulness and awareness.
Reassures Jedediah about the archive relocation, expresses confidence in their happiness.
Gently tucks Jedediah in with packing peanuts, lingers hand on the box lid before closing.
Observes and shows concern when Teddy Roosevelt notes Larry seems 'not quite yourself'.
Reassures Jedediah confidently about the archive situation and takes care to tuck him in securely.
Hesitates and lingers hand on the sealed box, showing some uncertainty or emotional conflict.
Observes the situation calmly and interacts thoughtfully with Teddy Roosevelt, showing awareness of complex truths.
Says 'things are good' despite Teddy Roosevelt sensing he is 'not quite himself,' indicating possible reluctance to fully disclose his feelings or doubts.
Watches sadly as the moving truck pulls out, indicating emotional attachment and sadness.
Responds supportively to his son's question about a girl liking him with encouragement and open-mindedness.
Acknowledges being tired after long hours but remains self-aware and honest about his state.
Reacts emotionally and screams at Teddy Roosevelt after he freezes, showing frustration but also willingness to express himself.
Watches sadly as the moving truck leaves the museum, indicating a sense of loss and reflection.
Responds supportively and adaptively to his son's social concerns, demonstrating emotional intelligence.
Waves off his son from answering the phone, assuming it is work, possibly showing dismissiveness or tiredness.
Responds quickly to Jedediah's urgent message, showing concern and immediate attention to a distress situation.
Collaborates with Nick by asking questions and considering details about the Smithsonian and the Tablet, showing openness and shared problem solving.
Starts investigating the strange call promptly by asking questions about the federal archives.
Shows curiosity and tries to understand the connection between the Tablet and the Smithsonian, indicating thoughtful analysis.
Relies on Nick to do most of the research on the computer, showing a more passive role in information gathering.
Questions the presence of a dangerous historical figure at the Smithsonian and processes new information carefully.
Considers going to the authorities but quickly dismisses the idea due to impracticality and the unusual nature of the situation.
Expresses reluctance to take responsibility, saying it's not his job anymore and doubts the seriousness of the threat.
Engages thoughtfully with Nick’s Star Wars reference, correcting the quote and showing attention to detail.
Politely responds to the guard's admonishment about touching the ancient gate by saying he wasn't going to touch it.
Checks map and follows it carefully through complex museum galleries.
Hurries through the sculpture gallery after briefly looking at the sculptures, indicating focus on his goal.
Reaches out to the indentation for the Tablet of Ahkmenrah despite a guard warning, showing some lack of caution or respect for rules.
Quickly responds to the guard’s accusation with plausible denials, showing ability to think on his feet.
Engages in a tense exchange with Guard Brandon, attempts to get supervisor's name but walks away without escalating conflict.
Gives casual, friendly greeting to bored museum guard while in disguise.
Laughs along with the guard's teasing about Brandon and jokes about shirt size, pats the guard on the back, and offers to help set him up in the morning.
Effectively handles fitting uniforms for staff, engages with them confidently, and uses a keycard to access a restricted area without hesitation.
Coordinates over phone with Nick, confirming location and setting a timer to manage limited time in a complex environment.
Nods politely to guards as they pass by.
Hides his face 'casually' to avoid detection at security gate.
Sets the timer on his watch and tries to follow directions to navigate a complex underground maze.
Responds quickly to losing phone reception by attempting to regain it.
Hustles and pushes through obstacles upon hearing unfamiliar voices and potential interruption.
Checks his watch to make a calculated decision on which direction to take in a corridor.
Nods at approaching guards to appear casual and then breaks into a jog once out of sight.
Casually hides his face before using a potentially stolen ID to bluff through security.
Takes a deep breath, persists in searching despite being overwhelmed and unsure where to start.
Checks on exhibits needing care (Amelia Earhart tagged 'FOR CLEANING, ASAP'), indicating awareness and responsibility despite being pressed for time.
Moves quickly and frantically through the museum searching for something, suggesting urgency but no direct interaction or hostile behavior.
Moves cautiously through a hazardous area, noticing details like General Custer and Amelia Earhart exhibits, and checks his watch indicating awareness of time constraints.
Runs frantically into a dead end, freezes upon discovering a dangerous scene.
Realizes the danger and tries to rescue his friends trapped in the crate, using resourcefulness to retrieve the Tablet.
Squeezes into a risky situation despite difficulty and potential harm, showing care and concern for others.
Feels apprehensive and overwhelmed but persists in his attempt to save his friends.
Uses a gold crook from a Guard to hook the Tablet into his backpack after failing to reach it by hand.
Attempts to squeeze into the crate but cannot fit.
Realizes he is cornered and his backpack starts glowing ominously, then runs face to face into a powerful adversary.
Responds politely and acknowledges Kahmunrah speaking English well.
Clutches the Tablet protectively when threatened, showing responsibility and concern.
Communicates clearly and calmly with Kahmunrah despite tense situation, understands and responds appropriately to Kahmunrah's questions.
Maintains composure while being surrounded by armed warriors and a threatening figure, avoiding panic or aggression.
Clutches the Tablet when it is taken from him, showing some hesitation or lack of immediate counteraction.

Contemplates Kahmunrah's demand for the Tablet, indicating a thoughtful approach instead of immediate aggression or compliance.
Recognizes the significance of the Tablet and comes up with an idea to use the antagonist's ignorance about another object to his advantage.

Warns Kahmunrah not to open the crate for everyone's safety.
Blurts out row information under threat, showing a little panic but no betrayal.
Tells the giant squid to stay, tries to stop it despite being cornered.

Stands up after being dumped from the sidecar and tries to keep composure.
Seemingly hesitant and uncertain about charging with Custer against the Egyptians.

Helps Amelia try to barricade the door and protect their location from the bad guys.

Is caught off guard when hit by a snowball and reacts with surprise.
Thinks fast under pressure and uses a pitchfork to defend against guards, showing quick thinking and a willingness to protect.

Answers phone calmly despite chaotic situation.
